tweets.text: Class 2 have been so engaged in Geography lessons this term. It's been great to see them get involved in protecting our environment and learning about climate change. Today, they wrote persuasive letters to @BorisJohnson @HouseofCommons to persuade him to act on climate change. https://t.co/wj9b8IKxrw

#Water firms discharged raw #sewage into rivers and coastal waters in England more than 400,000 times last yr, says @EnvAgency.  How did they manage to get away with this behaviour  so long? Is it the need to keep bills down? @AnglingTrust @angling_times @CraigBennett3

@lakesauctioneer @iandicko73 @EnvAgency Happening a long time when pumping stations are sighted with overflow for sewage direct to rivers if they have a problem, little storage to allow for repairs .has stopped here over flow seems to be blocked . https://t.co/qiYTWjPYNm

@elverdave @BierbergThomas @SEGandrewK It’s a good thing that they are moved past barriers in the Uk. Surely there are reasons why eels are scarce elsewhere?
If there are no elvermen next year (can’t see that happening though)it will be interesting to hear the policy the @EnvAgency has for future eel survival.

tweets.text: With lockdown restrictions easing and a warm Easter expected, please be outdoor swimming savvy and enjoy water https://t.co/tp9IoiIKQG are some top tips from @RLSSUK @Swim_England @BritTri https://t.co/SyFtYje7Cj #BePrepared #BeWaterAware #WaterSafety ⁦@EnvAgencySE⁩ ⁦ https://t.co/yusANhagQs

Another night when thousands of houses get gassed @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency What punishment should @RedIndustries2  have for gassing a community? This can't be allowed to continue.

Sorry you missed out on the opportunity to talk about bottom ash... 
Looking forward to the Tacoma Narrows episode next week.
@StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @RedIndustries2 Class action lawsuit for 20,000 homes at £10,000 each would stop it.

We are responding to a serious fish kill at Newton-Le-Willows #StHelens. Our officers & @sthelenscouncil are investigating the cause & taking action to avoid any further fish deaths

Our thanks go to the fast-acting members of the public who reported this to us on 0800 80 70 60
@1970Jdk @StinkStopthe @MissyDoom @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @AaronBell4NUL Please don’t stop reporting it to the EA 🙏🏽 I know it’s a pain but it will hold value and make a change trust in that

tweets.text: We need some visible leadership on this @EnvAgency not faceless generic e-updates. Do we have a lead exec level contact yet @StinkStopthe We need someone to step up to the plate & assure us that these fumes will be stopped, how & when! @MPGeorgeEustice @BorisJohnson https://t.co/keNpg8WZKP

@PRL_Jones I have recently been told operation nosedive has been abandoned. Investigation into £154m waste fraud dropped. The OCG’s are now free to splash their ill gotten cash. Right under the noses of @EnvAgency who choose to look the other way.
‘I feel very angry’ – TV presenter @SteveBackshall ‘frustrated’ as sewage enters the River Thames https://t.co/OsmqXpPnt3

How on earth is this allowed to happen @EnvAgency ? Whatever the “reason” https://t.co/kc9dROI2HF

tweets.text:
@annjsmall @StinkStopthe @SianieRoo @BorisJohnson @EnvAgency I don't see how other landfills can virtually eliminate bad odour in a few short months and these idiots keep making it worse - when they're accepting the same types of waste and employing the same techniques technology and equipment.
I find it totally baffling 🤔

And now we know why government have been so busy over the last couple of days.

In 2019 water companies spent over 3,100,000 hours, on over 400,000 occasions dumping sh*t into our rivers and seas.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/sUsBYs5msz

tweets.text: Another HUGE result for our campaign. Now North Marsh transformed at Brent Reservoir (Welsh Harp). Water level up, large debris GONE. More action like this, @CanalRiverTrust! Thank you. Big message to public that owners care. Silt and microplastics next!✊🏞️ https://t.co/Udm56Aj3GF

Is it just me or are government now actually spending taxpayers money paying for adverts in national newspapers trying to explain away the fact that they allowed water companies to dump sewage into our rivers for over 3,100,000 hours in 2020?

Blimey. https://t.co/wbmzp8rhlh

tweets.text: Makes very depressing reading but we suspect things are much worse than the figures show. The @EnvAgency  have a bizarre way of counting spills. For example in 2020 the @RiverChess experienced 50 spills on consecutive days, they counted it as 1 spill. https://t.co/1AXYE2A3a0

@NickMott7 @stwater @CatchmentDove @The_RRC @EnvAgencyMids @WildTroutTrust @ChurnetValley @EAGeomorphology @theriverstrust @CaBAtweets @BiodiversityEA @Buzz_dont_tweet Looks great Nick, and a refreshing opproach!
@easylec @BierbergThomas @SEGandrewK We end up  restocking because nobody wants them I think this year will probably be the last for this fishery it’s sad but true

@StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @RedIndustries2 Day after day, after day, night after night - @NewsNBC are living the groundhog stink day...How many more complaints do the @EnvAgency are needed? It’s woke my family up again... This is a health crisis, time for the Secretary of State for the environment to act  #stopthestink https://t.co/vmK1dPZmpF

tweets.text: Looks like the @EnvAgency and @DefraGovUK missed a trick when they issued the latest data on sewage discharges today. If they had waited 24 hrs the public would have thought it was a joke. Surely the UK would not permit untreated sewage to be discharged into seas and rivers. https://t.co/ljtrHuNUzq

@lakesauctioneer @NRenison Have a look at this from The Rivers Trust, the frequency and duration of some of the discharges is incredible 

https://t.co/vHzJHZJ9un

urls.title: Event duration monitoring – lifting the lid on storm overflows
urls.description: On today's blog we look into the 2020 Event Duration Monitoring Data, which is fundamental to understanding and improving the environment.

tweets.text:
Storm overflows performance data to inland and coastal waters has been published for all water companies in England.

For information on storm overflows and a link to the full data and a summary of the key statistics, read our blog post: https://t.co/51zRnT2fSi https://t.co/cLtFlAR7jt

tweets.text: Today the  @EnvAgency and @DefraGovUK have fail to point out the 50 days of sewage discharge in 2020 and 62 days already in 2021 and rising into the River Chess are all un-permitted, they are a breach of permit.

Superb to have finally completed this!

It's been designed to be deliberately unstable to allow the stream to build its own habitats and choose its own pathways.

Completed as part of the Action for #Invertebrates project funded by @stwater Great Big Nature Boost https://t.co/EBd7iD0Zem https://t.co/ylMkSoO7oU
